holidays.name: Hug Your Cat Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to showing your feline friends some extra love and cuddles! Perfect for cat lovers who want to spoil their whiskered companions.
holidays.origin: Started by cat enthusiasts and social media communities celebrating the bond between humans and cats.
holidays.funFact: Cats often purr louder when being hugged, interpreting it as a sign of affection and comfort.

holidays.name: Cheese Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the incredible world of cheese by indulging in your favorite varieties — from sharp cheddar to creamy brie or funky blue cheese!
holidays.origin: Likely created by cheese lovers and food enthusiasts to appreciate this ancient dairy delicacy.
holidays.funFact: There are over 2,000 distinct varieties of cheese worldwide, ranging from soft to hard and mild to pungent!

holidays.name: International Day of Innocent Children Victims of Aggression
holidays.description: A solemn day recognized by the United Nations to acknowledge the pain suffered by children who are victims of physical, mental, and emotional abuse worldwide.
holidays.origin: Established by the UN in 1982 as a reminder of the importance of protecting children everywhere.
holidays.funFact: Despite its somber theme, many communities hold events emphasizing healing and hope for children affected by violence.

holidays.name: Leave the Office Early Day
holidays.description: An unofficial, much-loved holiday encouraging workers to finish up their tasks promptly and head home early for some well-deserved relaxation!
holidays.origin: Origin unclear, but popularized in workplace culture to boost morale and work-life balance.
holidays.funFact: Some companies offer rewards for employees who leave early showing high productivity during the day.
